ActAeronautics Act
SubjectRegulations Amending the Canadian Aviation Regulations (Parts I and VI – Flight Data Recorder and Cockpit Voice Recorder)
PrecisRegulations Amending the CANADIAN AVIATION REGULATIONS (PARTS I AND VI – FLIGHT DATA RECORDER AND COCKPIT VOICE RECORDER) in order to (1) enhance the time period capture of Cockpit Voice Recorder (CVR) information, by extending the recording time from 30 minutes to two hours for those aircraft manufactured before 2003; (2) ensure the continued function of the CVR system in the case of a total aircraft power failure by requiring the use of a Recorder Independent Power Supply that will last for a 10-minute period for those aircraft manufactured after 2002 and already required to have a two hour CVR; (3) fully implement the International Civil Aviation Organization standards with respect to CVR and to align the Canadian Aviation Regulations with the United States Federal Aviation Administration standards in Title 14 of the United States Code of Federal Regulations. The amendments will capture all Canadian in-service aeroplanes over 5,700 kg and transport helicopters over 7,000 kg; and (4) clarify that a CVR is required anytime a multi-engine turbine powered aircraft capable of carrying six passengers or more is operated by two pilots.
